Help:Node.title: Containers
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Containers
Important Commands: put, look, take
Containers are movable objects that may be used to hold other objects. They include pouches, boxes, trunks, and any number of other items.
To put an object in a container, type $(udat.chatchar)PUT [OBJECT] IN [CONTAINER], for example, $(udat.chatchar)PUT BREAD ROLL IN POUCH. To remove an item type $(udat.chatchar)TAKE [OBJECT] FROM [CONTAINER]. You may determine the contents of a container by typing $(udat.chat)LOOK AT [CONTAINER].
Some objects may be opened or closed: $(udat.chatchar)OPEN [CONTAINER] or $(udat.chatchar)CLOSE [CONTAINER]. You may only look in containers, put objects in containers, or remove objects from containers if they are opened.
Once they have been closed, some containers may be locked as well, protecting your valuables.
See Also: , ,
